captions.text: This month, many countries around the world will be spreading awareness on multiple

sclerosis, or "MS".  A disease that
affects millions of people worldwide.  But
what exactly is multiple sclerosis? MS primarily affects the central

nervous system which consists of the
brain, spinal cord and optic nerve.  Just

about everything you do depends on this
system functioning properly, from

breathing to moving and even watching
youtube videos.  And these actions are all

facilitated by neurons throughout your body,
cells which we've talked about many

times in our previous videos.  These
neurons are able to send signals all

throughout the body at incredible
speeds, in part because of the fatty
coating that surrounds them
something called myelin or the myelin sheath.

This myelin insulates the impulses and
allows the nerve signals to reach their

destination, however in the case of
MS this is where the issues occur.

The immune system is designed to fight
off disease from viruses, bacteria,

parasites or other agents and does so by
distinguishing these things from healthy

tissue.  But in the case of MS, the immune
system ends up attacking the myelin in
what is classified as an auto-immune disorder.

This process of de-myelination can lead
to a build above scar tissue, hence the

word sclerosis.  The CNS then becomes
unable to send and receive signals

properly.  Messages traveling along
neurons may be slowed down, distorted or

stopped altogether.  Because of the
bearing, locations and nature of de-myelination,

the symptoms of MS are
incredibly diverse.  They can range from

muscle weakness to decreased coordination,
fatigue, vision problems, numbness or even
paralysis.

Though an MRI scan of the brain to
look for lesions or scarring is integral
to diagnosis.

For some, the symptoms come as acute
episodes while others experience more

chronic and permanent symptoms, which
worsen over time.  At this point no true

cause or cure is known.  While potential
links to environmental factors, viral

infections and genetics have been found,
studies are ongoing and not yet

conclusive.  And while their has been a lot of work
towards not only alleviating some of the

symptoms but slowing the progression,
sadly these treatments do not work for

all MS sufferers. Ultimately, bringing
like to this issue in an effort to

support and fund research is an
incredibly important step to erasing MS.

And though many of us will
never truly understand the challenges of
living with MS,

we can work together to raise awareness.
We would be so grateful if you could

take a moment and pass this video on to
your family and friends and join in the
effort to end MS.

This episode of AsapSCIENCE is supported by
23andMe.  23andMe is a

DNA analysis service that allows you
to explore your own genes, whether you're

interested in discovering a global
origins for understand you're health and your

risk for disease, be they sure to check out
23andme.com/asap

With the help of their DNA kits, connect to
your past, learn about your present health and

potentially be a part of future genetic research
all at 23andme.com/asap
And subscribe for more weekly science videos.

My neurologist believes I might have ms as well. I have one lesion on my 
brain but my symptoms are questionable. Numbness in the middle of my face, 
numbness and weakness on my hands, some numbness in my feet. Memory 
problems, noble to contraction sometimes. Hands also become stiff. I'm 
getting three more mri's on my spine and an emg and spinal tap.﻿

comments.author: TG Jay449

comments.text:
MS is genetic, this and a lot of other diseases are transferred and carried 
by genes, passing on to the next generation. I seriously believe something 
should be done to stop the spread of these genes. I know a lot of you have 
MS, and I have contributed to fundraising for the disease myself, but it is 
really, really selfish to attempt to have kids when you KNOW you have said 
disease or disorder, therefore carrying the flawed gene on and on, 
continuing the spread and lifespan of it. People who choose to have kids 
when they know they have these disorders sicken me, you care more about 
having kids for yourself then fighting these disorders, knowing that your 
kids could contract these as well as their kids. Please, if you have a 
serious genetic flaw, don't be selfish and do what's best for the survival 
of humanity.﻿
comments.author: xPaNzzErr

comments.text:
Ellemi0090, you want the human race to go extinct, and death is inevitable,

always exist.

childern gets will get unless as i have a said both parents carry the gene 
and even then its a  1 and 4 chance of passing it on.

 I believe that the person that you are replying to was being sarcastic.

comments.author: Cayden Sunderland

comments.text:
I'm sorry but what the hell?!?! People can have kids if they want, and just 
because the parents have the flawed gene it doesn't mean that their kids 
will get it too, it all depends on what genes they get, heck they might not 
even pass it on, and these kids are also the only people that would be 
willing to care for their sick parent when it got worse, and these people 
are having children so that they can have a light in their world, even for 
a short time, because that kid is a part of them, that will be left behind 
on earth in the image of their parent, God has a plan for us all, and if 
bringing these people and possibly their kids away from our darkened, 
world, even in the way of disease and disorders, is his plan, and it brings 
them to a better place, and what do you mean ten out of ten births result 
in death, that is the circle of life, everyone will die from something, and 
not every child patient is admitted to a hospital because their parents 
have the flawed gene that they passed on, that is more on the rarer scale, 
but because if accidents, emergencies, and other illnesses that they did 
not get from their parents, so the next time you shoot a Nasty look at 
those parents, imagine the hell that they are going through because their 
child, the very thing that they live for, is sitting in a hospital because 
they are sick or dying, I mean they are already beating themselves up for 
what is happening, and you don't know why there child is there, and with 
that look you will make their lives a thousand times worse, because it 
makes them think others are judging them, it makes them think that others 
are judging them because they couldn't give their amazing child what they 
needed, you are despicable, next time, before you go and put a grieving, 
saddened family into an even deeper depression, think, just use the brain 
that God have you to use!
comments.author: Cayden Sunderland

comments.text:
I totally agree. In fact, everyone should stop having kids. Apparently, 
being born comes with high risks of being infected by viruses or getting 
mental diseases that will make your life pretty miserable. People who 
choose to have kids when they know those children can get sick and ACTUALLY 
DIE sickens me, you care more about having kids for yourself than fighting 
disease. Why the fuck should I get a kid when it could turn out to have 
breast cancer when she's 54 years old? Whenever I see children in 
hospitals, I always send mean looks at their parents: your child wouldn't 
have been in that hospital bed suffering and floating between death and 
life IF YOU HAVEN'T GIVEN BIRTH TO IT. Stunning facts show that 10 out of 
10 births end with death, it's outrageous that people don't take this more 
seriously and attempts to stop all this suffering. Everyone knows it's not 
a human right to have kids, so for the sake of your child: don't have it.
comments.author: ellemi0090

comments.text:
You mean intersex? And you need to be more specific. It means that either 
your genitals are mixed, the vital parts of both genders are mixed (eg. 
Breasts and a penis on one person) or a mixture of the X and Y chromosomes 
like an XXY pairing, off the top of my head. And it might cause most of 
them to appear androgynous. This is just what I can think of, with no 
specific research having been done immediately prior, so I may be wrong.

comments.text:
And actually a person needs to come in contact with bodily fluids of an 
animal carrying the Ebola virus, and when that happens the person contracts 
the disease and it multiplies and evolves. And then it is spread from 
contact of skin on skin, not just bodily fluids although that would allow 
you to contract the disease much faster.
comments.author: Cayden Sunderland

comments.text:
It doesn't matter, Ebola isn't a year round thing, it is severe, but it has 
been put under control, Ebola is a haemorrhagic fever that causes internal 
bleeding and brain haemorrhages. Since MS isn't contagious, people needed 
to focus on putting Ebola in its place because it was posing a threat world 
wide. Now I'm not saying that MS isn't as Important, in my opinion it is a 
tragic, terrible disease that should not exist, but it will take many years 
before a cure can be found, whereas with Ebola we were able to control it 
and find potential cures quicker and easier because it isn't as complex as 
MS. Please don't take this the wrong way, I'm just saying what I know.
comments.author: Cayden Sunderland

comments.text:
+Charlie R Have you tried cannabis for treatment? Its not a cure, but it 
might help with the symptoms
comments.author: imthetank3

comments.text:
Not even 200,000 people have Ebola, and millions have MS, including me. We 
already know how to treat Ebola, for god sakes, it's not even easy to catch 
the virus. It's spread through bodily fluids.

Ebola is a priority right now, but people actually can get rid of Ebola. 
People can't get rid of Multiple Sclerosis.

comments.text:
+John Gabriele Your wrong. My father is also immobile do to this disease, 
and you havent a clue what your talking about. It effected his brain, which 
sends out signals to all of the limbs organs and such throughout the body. 
the nerves sending messages to the leg from the brain is where the immune 
system attacked the myeline. That's how. Please don't call people wrong 
when they are being effected like this on a daily basis and your just 
basing your facts off of a video you didn't understand completely
comments.author: EC Qwolf

informing you.
comments.author: John Gabriele

comments.text: My dad has ms in his left leg and he can never walk again ﻿
comments.author: beth pritchard

comments.text:
thank you :) I was gonna message you to ask you to do a video about MS but 
first searched your videos and found this ^.^ I am glad you guys covered it﻿
comments.author: uritemzrmine

comments.text:
I am using Rebif 3 times a week, i used to have a much larger dose. the 
depression and emotions that comes along with ms are sometimes very severe, 
along with severe depression comes suicidal thoughts. i live in the dutch 
caribbean so i also have a perscripion of medical cannabis witch i have 
used in episodes and cases of extreme brain pain, partial paralysis and 
alien arm.. i felt pushed in the corner, only negative feelings and i 
remembered the relief the cannabis has brought me when i was in a episode. 
so i began using it on a daily basis, smoking,eating,making tea. the 
cannabis i receive here in bonaire is hi with cbd and lo with thc, so it 
doesn't get me hi. i have found that yoga a few times a week, a healthy 
diet and constant use of cannabis my alien arm is gone, numbing and partial 
paralyses is 99% gone, episodes only last 1-2 days instead of 3-4 weeks and 
are much less frequent, emotions and depression are much more manageable. 
many people with ms have a problem remembering, the genaral thought process 
is messed up. but just as important as remembering is, forgetting is 
exactly important. when i smoke or eat a cookie, i can forget and go places 
witch are peaceful and dont have to worry. the fatigue is also helped 
because my body gets a chance to relax, maybe more importand then my body 
is my mind and it also gets a chance to relax, to slow down, to stop the 
rush and it does make it "ok" much more tolerable. life with ms is bad 
enought, life with ms without cannabis is hell. this morning i will focus 
on positive things, i will make a fruit shake no sugar no milk. i will do 
30mins yoga. and i will smoke 1 gram of cbd canabis. if i am up for it, 
maybe later today i will go swimming or to the beach. something to remember 
for everyone with ms. exacly that, you have ms, ms doesnt have you. one 
love.﻿
comments.author: Christian Anders

comments.text:
How does ALS affect the brain? And, if you were to do this video, my 
grandpa Irv Kuske died of ALS. And it would mean the world to me if you 
were to put his name somewhere in the end of the video. Or dedicated to. 
Thanks! ﻿

comments.text:
WHAT IS MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS? 

Millions of people around the world suffer from MS, but what is it? Lets 
shine a light on this disease in an effort to increase awareness. Please 
share, if you can :)

Written and created by Mitchell Moffit (twitter @mitchellmoffit) and 
Gregory Brown (twitter @whalewatchmeplz).
